title: OmegaStarScream
author: OmegaStarScream
content: I would imagine that the cheapest way would be to use a CEX. Could you recommend one to me? I know that OKX supports Linea but I have stopped using them since they implemented KYC. I need to transfer the funds from Polygon zkEVM but I'm flexible. I don't mind going through Bitcoin, or some other coin if needed as long as the process is as cheap as possible. I'm aware of bridges like Orbiter Finance, but that's a bit too expensive (for the small amount I'm trying to move).

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: Centralized Exchanges these days almost have KYC (most of the trusted) so if you want to be more safe. Go for these platforms that already working, like cryptoadditchie suggested above.Among the list above, I only tried Stargate Finance. But I can suggest here, like using Orbiter. I already tried this bridge platform for most of the new layer-2 networks.Another thing is seems most bridge platform these days are almost  the same fees, it will only depends on which network are you in.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 04, 2023, 09:27:57 AM...I'm aware of bridges like Orbiter Finance, but that's a bit too expensive (for the small amount I'm trying to move).Since you have a small balance in the Polygon zkEVM network , you need to use the service https://www.bungee.exchange/refuel , which allows you to replenish gas from the zkEVM network in zkSync. Thus, the cost of transferring ETH from one network to another will amount to several tens of cents.

comments.author: goxcraft
comments.body: There are several options out there, but after the exploit of Multi chain Bridge, I do not trust most of them. I was using these two sites for bridging, and they have worked fine for me till now. Symbiosis: Have a wide range of supported currencies, including USDC, USDT, and DAI, along with ETH as a native currency. Orbiter: You can bridge mostly ETH and USDC.

comments.author: Rimueng
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 04, 2023, 09:27:57 AMI would imagine that the cheapest way would be to use a CEX. Could you recommend one to me? I know that OKX supports Linea but I have stopped using them since they implemented KYC. I need to transfer the funds from Polygon zkEVM but I'm flexible. I don't mind going through Bitcoin, or some other coin if needed as long as the process is as cheap as possible. I'm aware of bridges like Orbiter Finance, but that's a bit too expensive (for the small amount I'm trying to move).I think almost all bridge platforms require transaction fees, if you ask me, it's "expensive". I've tried maybe but at that time eth to bsc. I did not try with other networks bsc to polygon (matic) or others but if you have assets yes approximately under $20 I think it will be difficult to find a bridge with a small fee. Perhaps you can try off-chain which does not require gas fees when transferring assets between users on the same platform, such as using a centralized exchange. But still these usually require KYC verification.
